name: Frequency Shifter
description: This algorithm is based on the Frequency Shifter algorithm from the disting EX. It shifts frequency (not pitch), meaning it adds a fixed offset to all harmonic frequencies in an audio signal rather than scaling them uniformly like a pitch shifter. This process breaks harmonic relationships, producing 'clangorous' or 'bell-like' sounds. The algorithm allows adjustment of shift parameters such as frequency offset, multiplier, CV scaling, wet/dry mix, and output level, along with routing controls for input/output busses and mode selection (Add/Replace) for positive and negative shifted outputs.
use_cases: Creating metallic or bell-like sounds by breaking harmonic relationships
Adding frequency modulation effects to audio signals
Generating clangorous textures for sound design
CV-controlled frequency shifting in modular setups

parameters.name: Multiplier
parameters.description: Set a multiplier for the shift amount: x1, x10, x100, or x1000.

parameters.name: Hz/V
parameters.description: Sets the scaling of the shift CV input, in Hz/Volt. One of: 1Hz/V, 10Hz/V, 100Hz/V, or 1kHz/V.

parameters.name: Level
parameters.description: The output gain applied to the effected signal.

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

parameters.name: +ve shift mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector for the positive shifted output.

parameters.name: -ve shift mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector for the negative shifted output.

input_ports.name: Shift input
input_ports.description: CV input bus for frequency shift control (0-28).

input_ports.name: Shift input
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the frequency shift CV.

output_ports.name: +ve shift output
output_ports.description: Bus for the positive shifted audio output.

output_ports.name: -ve shift output
output_ports.description: Bus for the negative shifted audio output.

output_ports.name: +ve shift output
output_ports.description: The bus to use for the positive shifted output.

output_ports.name: -ve shift output
output_ports.description: The bus to use for the negative shifted output.
